properties.description: application configuration properties
The role configuration properties of the application
In order to enable allowing to delete indices via wildcards or _all, set this config to false.
properties.label: action_destructive_requires_name

properties.description: The max size of the field data cache.
properties.label: indices_fielddata_cache_size

properties.description: The ip of one of logstash node used to collect logs on elasticsearch.
properties.label: logstash_node_ip

properties.description: The discovery.zen.no_master_block settings controls what operations should be rejected when there is no active master.
properties.label: discovery_zen_no_master_block

properties.description: If the expected number of nodes is not achieved, the recovery process waits for the configured amount of time before trying to recover regardless. Defaults to 5m if one of the expected_nodes settings is configured.
properties.label: gateway_recover_after_time

properties.description: Enable or disable cross-origin resource sharing, i.e. whether a browser on another origin can execute requests against Elasticsearch.
properties.label: http_cors_enabled

properties.description: Which origins to allow.
properties.label: http_cors_allow_origin

properties.description: Controls the memory size for the filter cache , defaults to 10%. Accepts either a percentage value, like 5%, or an exact value, like 512mb.
properties.label: indices_queries_cache_size

properties.description: Accepts either a percentage or a byte size value. It defaults to 10%, meaning that 10% of the total heap allocated to a node will be used as the indexing buffer size shared across all shards.
properties.label: indices_memory_index_buffer_size

properties.description: The shard-level request cache module caches the local results on each shard. The cache is managed at the node level, and has a default maximum size of 1% of the heap.
properties.label: indices_requests_cache_size

properties.description: Specify whether scripts with inline type are allowed.
properties.label: script_inline

properties.description: Specify whether scripts with stored type are allowed.
properties.label: script_stored

properties.description: Specify whether scripts with file type are allowed.
properties.label: script_file

properties.description: Specify whether scripts can be executed in aggregations context.
properties.label: script_aggs

properties.description: Specify whether scripts can be executed in search context.
properties.label: script_search

properties.description: Specify whether scripts can be executed in update context.
properties.label: script_update

properties.description: Specify the location of extensional dictionary from remote.
properties.label: remote_ext_dict

properties.description: Specify the location of extensional stopwords dictionary from remote.
properties.label: remote_ext_stopwords

properties.description: The role configuration properties of the application
Whether to enable elasticsearch-head.
properties.label: enable_elasticsearch_head

properties.description: Whether to enable ElasticHD.
properties.label: enable_elastichd

properties.description: Whether to enable Cerebro.
properties.label: enable_cerebro

properties.description: Whether to enable elasticsearch-sql.
properties.label: enable_elasticsearch_sql

properties.description: The role configuration properties of the application
When you run logstash, you use the -f to specify your config file, and this config is what your config file contained in input section
properties.label: input_conf_content

properties.description: When you run logstash, you use the -f to specify your config file, and this config is what your config file contained in filter section
properties.label: filter_conf_content

properties.description: When you run logstash, you use the -f to specify your config file, and this config is what your config file contained in output section
properties.label: output_conf_content

properties.description: When you run logstash, you use the -f to specify your config file, and this config is what your config file contained in output elasticsearch section
properties.label: output_es_content

properties.description: This config is used to adding content into Gemfile for logstash
properties.label: gemfile_append_content
